glosses: To turn away or avoid someone seeking to talk

examples.translation: I dashed into the bathroom to get rid of him.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish باشدان صاومق (başdan ṣavmaḳ, “to tell one politely to go about his business, to get rid of”). Morphologically baş (“head”) + -ı + -ndan + sav- (“to fend off, to get rid of”) + -mak. Literally, “to fend off from one’s head”.
